text: Um, uh...
ugh, sorry, Amy,

I can't remember
where the other bike is.
Just take a guess.

I mean, last time your recall
improved 50% with the gum.

- And this time...
- Not so great, no?

You're actually worse
than you were without the gum.

- Did anything change?
- Not that I can think of.

Oh! I did stop taking
the muscle relaxers last week.
Muscle relaxers.

Being in less pain probably
helped your performance.

I hope I didn't screw up
your experiment.

- No. It's all just part of it.
- Ah.

I should tell Robby
to hold off on that article

until I test a wider sample.
Do you know where he is?

- Right here.
- Oh. Hey.

You can't write that article
about my experiment.

I know, because I already did.
It's in today's paper.

Our astrologist missed
her deadline,

so we needed something
to fill the space.

I thought you
were waiting for data.
Well, I didn't need it.

I decided to focus
on the human angle.

But your dad's improvements
aren't because of the gum,

it's because
he was taking muscle relaxers.

What about your other
test subjects?

I mean,
there were slight uptakes,

but your dad's results
were the most drastic
and they skewed all the data.

You have to unpublish
that story.

Well, I can't.
It's printed. Look.
Okay. Just don't worry.

Our readership is very,
very low.

- ( phone vibrating )
- Oh, my gosh.

Dr. Manning. I'm sure
this is just a coincidence.

I mean, she definitely doesn't
read the Collinsville newspaper.
Yeah, probably not.

Ooh, although.
I did call her for a quote.

- No.
- Yeah.
No, no, no. Um, okay.
Hi, Dr. Manning.

Oh, it's so lovely
to hear from you.

Yeah, my research
is very promising.
You want me to present it
to your doctoral students.

Great. Yeah,
that is just so great.
Thanks.

It's not the worst thing
in the world.
Yes, it is.

She's going
to think that I lied

about my experiment
in the newspaper,

and then my science career
is going to be over forever.

Okay, what if you just
didn't tell her the truth?

I can't do that.
That's cheating.

Who's going to know?
You, me, and my dad.

I mean, Einstein did fudge the
numbers on E=MC squared

so it would gain
widespread acceptance,

and it was never proven
until after his death.

And everyone
thinks he's a genius.

I can believe I'm actually
considering this.

I need to talk to someone
with a stronger moral compass.
Where's Holly?
